questions.question: How many inputs will a decimal-to-BCD encoder have?

explanations.c: A decimal-to-BCD encoder has 10 inputs, corresponding to the decimal digits 0 through 9, which are encoded into their Binary Coded Decimal (BCD) representation.

questions.question: The process of recording music on any recorder is called  _____________ .

explanations.b: Recording music in a recorder involves converting analog signals into a digital format, which is called encoding.

questions.question: The discrepancy of 0 output due to all inputs being 0 or D0, being 0 is resolved by using additional input known as _____________ .

explanations.a: The discrepancy of a 0 output due to all inputs being 0 or D0 being 0 is resolved by using an enable input, which allows the circuit to function correctly only when enabled.

questions.question: Can an encoder be refered as a multiplexer?

explanations.b: An encoder is not a transducer because it does not convert one form of energy to another (like a traditional transducer); it only converts input data to a different format (e.g., from decimal to binary).

questions.question: Among the following options, what is the function of an encoder?

explanations.b: An encoder converts quantized input values into their corresponding binary representation, effectively changing them into binary values.
